name: proscription
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of not allowing something: Proscription of the group could affect the trade negotiations. The bill contains broad proscriptions on land and water pollution. See
proscribe
More examplesFewer examplesA proscription on indoor smoking was passed by voters last fall. The new rules must not violate the constitutional proscription of unreasonable searches and seizures. The proscription order against the organization is still in force.
